overview_of_class: The purpose of the seminar is to give psychology graduate students an opportunity to get to know the faculty and their research interests. Every psychology faculty member will talk with the proseminar for one hour. In the fall quarter, the faculty from the Brain, Behavior, and Cogniton and the Cognitive areas participated, and in the winter quarter, the faculty from the Social and the Clinical and Personality areas participate. Also, three meetings are used for special presentations. In the fall, Stephan Hill from the Office of Fellowships described fellowship opportunities. In the winter, David Smith will discuss the teaching aspect of academic careers and describe the programs offered by the Searle Center for Teaching Excellence.
name: Proseminar-Social and Personality Basesof Behavior
subject: PSYCH
